Identification.LongTitle: Regulations Amending the Fort McKay First Nation Oil Sands Regulations

Provision.Text: Her Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister of Indigenous Services, makes the annexed Regulations Amending the Fort McKay First Nation Oil Sands Regulations under section 3a of the FIRST NATIONS COMMERCIAL AND INDUSTRIAL DEVELOPMENT ACTb.

Heading.Label: PART 1
Heading.TitleText: Adaptations Applicable to Incorporated Laws

Section.Text: An English term that is printed in a combination of parentheses and quotation marks in a provision of the French version of this Schedule is defined in the law that is adapted by that provision.
Incorporated laws are to be read without reference to provisions authorizing any person, provincial official or provincial body to expropriate any interest in lands.
Any obligation to pay a fee or charge under any incorporated law does not apply to His Majesty in right of Canada.

Subsection.Text: Any obligation or liability of an owner or a registered owner of land, buildings, structures or fixtures under any incorporated law does not apply to His Majesty in right of Canada.
If a consent, authorization or other approval of an owner or a registered owner of land is required under any incorporated law, it may only be given by the First Nation.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Notice to federal Minister and First Nation
Subsection.Text: If a notice or document is required to be given to an owner or a registered owner of land under any incorporated law, it must be given to both the federal Minister and the First Nation.

Section.Text: If the incorporated laws require a cash deposit or other financial security to be given, this requirement applies in addition to any other requirements that may apply to the project lands in relation to cash deposits or other financial security.

Subsection.Text: A power to search or make inspections under an incorporated law, including the power to enter a place, does not include a power to enter or search a federal government office, or to inspect anything in that office, without the consent of the person who is or appears to be in charge of that office.

A power to seize, remove or compel the production of documents under an incorporated law does not include a power to seize, remove or compel the production of a document in the possession of the federal government without the consent of the person in possession of the document.

Section.Text: A reference to “person who is indebted to the Government” or “person who is indebted to the Crown” under any incorporated law is to be read as to include a reference to a person who is indebted to the Government of Alberta, the Crown in right of Alberta, His Majesty in right of Canada or the First Nation.
A reference to “person responsible” under any incorporated law does not include His Majesty in right of Canada.
Any provision referring to the Surface Rights Act of Alberta, RSA 2000, c. S-24, or to rights under that Act does not apply with respect to the project lands.
Any provision referring to the Public Lands Act of Alberta, RSA 2000, c. P-40, or to rights under that Act does not apply with respect to the project lands.

Where an emergency response plan is required to be filed, submitted or otherwise made available to any person or body under any incorporated law, the person having the obligation to do so must, without delay,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: provide confirmation to the federal Minister and the First Nation that the obligation has been met; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if requested, provide a copy of the plan to the federal Minister and the First Nation.

Heading.Label: PART 2
Heading.TitleText: Adaptations to the Administrative Procedures and Jurisdiction Act of Alberta

Section.Text: A reference to “statute” in the definition statutory power in clause 1(c) of the Administrative Procedures and Jurisdiction Act of Alberta, RSA 2000, c. A-3, is to be read as including a reference to any statute of Alberta that applies with respect to the project lands by virtue of these Regulations.

Heading.Label: PART 3
Heading.TitleText: Adaptations to the Alberta Utilities Commission Act

Section.Text: In this Part, Act means the Alberta Utilities Commission Act, SA 2007, c. A-37.2.
A Commission decision or order specific to the project lands referred to in section 9 of the Act is deemed to directly and adversely affect the rights of the federal Minister and the First Nation.
A reference to “person” in sections 9 and 10 and in subsection 24(2) of the Act includes the federal Minister and the First Nation.
The federal Minister and the First Nation are deemed to be persons entitled to file applications for the purposes of section 10 and subsection 24(2) of the Act.
The Commission cannot direct that His Majesty in right of Canada pay any costs, money, expenses or penalties under sections 21 and 25 of the Act.
In subsection 26(2) of the Act, the reference to “interest in land” is to be read as a reference to “leasehold interest in land”.

Heading.Label: PART 4
Heading.TitleText: Adaptations to the Environmental Protection and Enhancement Act of Alberta and to the Regulations Made Under It

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this Part:

Definition.Text: Act means the Environmental Protection and Enhancement Act of Alberta, RSA 2000, c. E-12. (Loi)
Regulation means the Conservation and Reclamation Regulation of Alberta, AR 115/1993. (Règlement)

Heading.Label: DIVISION 1
Heading.TitleText: Adaptations to the Environmental Protection and Enhancement Act of Alberta

Section.Text: A reference to “any person who is directly affected” in the Act is to be read as including the federal Minister and the First Nation.
A reference to “person responsible” or “person responsible for the contaminated site” in the Act is to be read as excluding the First Nation.

Section.MarginalNote: Programs for use of economic instruments
Section.Text: No programs or other measures established under section 13 of the Act apply with respect to the project lands without the agreement of the federal Minister and the First Nation.

Subsection.Text: A reference to “local authority” in sections 27 and 28, subsections 110(3) and 115(3), sections 126, 130 and 220, subsection 233(1) and section 249 of the Act is to be read as including the First Nation and the Regional Municipality of Wood Buffalo.
A reference to “council” in subsection 233(1) of the Act is to be read as including the band council of the First Nation.

Section.Text: The reference to “Minister” in subsection 99(1) of the Act is to read as including a reference to the federal Minister.
For the purposes of subsection 100(1) of the Act, an order of the Minister is effective on the agreement in writing of the federal Minister.
A report or notice required under subsection 110(1), 110(3) or 115(3) or section 130 of the Act is to also be given without delay to the federal Minister and to the First Nation.
The reference to “mortgage or other security on land” in section 216 of the Act, is to be read as a reference to “mortgage or other security on a leasehold interest in land”.

Heading.Label: DIVISION 2
Heading.TitleText: Adaptations to the Conservation and Reclamation Regulation of Alberta

Section.Text: Any designation of a member of the band council of the First Nation or the council of the Regional Municipality of Wood Buffalo as an inspector under the Regulation has no effect with respect to the project lands.
A reference to “local authority” in subsection 4(2) and in section 17.1 of the Regulation is to be read as including the First Nation and the Regional Municipality of Wood Buffalo.

Subsection.Text: Section 24 of the Regulation is to be read without clause (2)(b) or subsection (4) or (7).
A reference to subsection 24(4) of the Regulation is to be read as a reference to subsection 24(3).
Subsection 24(3) of the Regulation is to be read as follows:
The Alberta Energy Regulator shall use security forfeited under subsection (1) to carry out the conservation and reclamation of the specified land in accordance with the Act and the regulations.
The reference to “Minister” in subsection 24(5) of the Regulation is to be read as a reference to “Alberta Energy Regulator”.

Heading.Label: PART 5
Heading.TitleText: Adaptations to the Geothermal Resource Development Act of Alberta

Section.Text: In this Part, Act means the Geothermal Resource Development Act of Alberta, SA 2020, c. G-5.5.
An order or direction of the Regulator made under section 5 of the Act must also be approved by the federal Minister.
For the purposes of section 11 of the Act,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the federal Minister or the First Nation may also require the Regulator to inquire into, examine or investigate any matter related to the purpose of the Act referred to in section 3 of the Act; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if an inquiry, examination or investigation is required by the Lieutenant Governor in Council of Alberta, the federal Minister or the First Nation, the Regulator must report its findings to both the federal Minister and the First Nation.

Section.Text: The Regulator cannot direct that His Majesty in right of Canada pay costs or expenses under section 17 or subsection 21(3) or 24(4) of the Act.
The reference to “interests in land” in subsection 23(2) of the Act is to be read as a reference to “leasehold interests in land”.
Any regulation made under the Act with respect to entry on a person’s land without the person’s agreement does not apply with respect to the project lands.

Heading.Label: PART 6
Heading.TitleText: Adaptations to the Historical Resources Act of Alberta

Section.Text: In this Part, Act means the Historical Resources Act of Alberta, RSA 2000, c. H-9.

Before exercising, or giving notice of an intention to exercise, any power with respect to historic resources, archaeological resources or palaeontological resources under sections 16, 20, 30, 33, 34 and 37 of the Act within the project lands, the Minister must obtain the agreement of the federal Minister and the First Nation.
The Act does not apply to affect the property in any archaeological resource or palaeontological resource within the project lands.
For greater certainty, the property in any record relating to historic resources prepared by the Crown in right of Alberta is vested in the Crown in right of Alberta.
Any regulation made under the Act respecting the sale, lease, exchange or disposition of archaeological resources or palaeontological resources does not apply with respect to the project lands.

Heading.Label: PART 7
Heading.TitleText: Adaptations to the Hydro and Electric Energy Act of Alberta

Section.Text: In this Part, Act means the Hydro and Electric Energy Act of Alberta, RSA 2000, c. H-16.
The Act applies to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: transmission lines that are used for oil sands mining activities on the project lands; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: power plants on the project lands.

Section.Text: The definition public highway in clause 1(1)(l) of the Act is to be read without reference to the words “owned by the Crown or a local authority”.
Only the federal Minister or the First Nation may give an approval under subsection 34(2) of the Act.
Any regulation made under the Act with respect to entry on a person’s land without that person’s agreement does not apply with respect to the project lands.

Heading.Label: PART 8
Heading.TitleText: Adaptations to the Oil and Gas Conservation Act of Alberta and to the Regulations Made Under It

Section.Text: In this Part, Act means the Oil and Gas Conservation Act of Alberta, RSA 2000, c. O-6.

Heading.Label: DIVISION 1
Heading.TitleText: Adaptations to the Oil and Gas Conservation Act of Alberta

Section.Text: For the purposes of subsection 18(2) of the Act, a direction of the Lieutenant Governor in Council of Alberta is effective on the agreement in writing of both the federal Minister and the First Nation.
A reference to a “debtor” in section 103 of the Act does not include His Majesty in right of Canada or the First Nation.
The Regulator cannot direct that His Majesty in right of Canada pay costs or expenses under subsection 104(3) or 105(4) of the Act.
An enforcement action under section 105 of the Act with respect to land can only be taken with respect to the leasehold interest in the project lands.

Heading.Label: DIVISION 2
Heading.TitleText: Adaptations to the Oil and Gas Conservation Rules of Alberta

Section.Text: A reference to “Alberta Land Surveyor” in clause 2.020(3.1)(c) of the of Alberta, AR 151/1971, is to be read as a reference to a Canada Lands Surveyor as defined in section 2 of the Canada Lands Surveyors Act.

Heading.Label: PART 9
Heading.TitleText: Adaptations to the Oil Sands Conservation Act of Alberta

Section.Text: In this Part, Act means the Oil Sands Conservation Act of Alberta, RSA 2000, c. O-7.

A reference to “the Lieutenant Governor in Council” in subsection 9(1) and in sub-clause 17(a)(ii) of the Act is to be read as a reference to the Lieutenant Governor in Council of Alberta, the federal Minister or the First Nation.
For the purposes of section 14 of the Act,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the federal Minister may direct that the Regulator conduct an inquiry relating to the compliance with a term or condition of an authorization of the Lieutenant Governor in Council of Alberta, and the Regulator must then comply with the procedure set out in subsection 14(2) of the Act;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if an inquiry is directed by the Lieutenant Governor in Council of Alberta or the federal Minister, the Regulator must report its findings to both of them; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a direction or other order made by the Lieutenant Governor in Council of Alberta under subsection 14(4) of the Act is effective on the agreement in writing of the federal Minister.

Subsection.Text: The notice under clause 15(3)(a) of the Act to rectify a default must also be given to the First Nation.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Notice and opportunity to be heard
Subsection.Text: The notice and the opportunity to be heard under clause 15(3)(b) of the Act must also be given to the First Nation.
A scheme referred to in section 18 of the Act cannot include lands that are not entirely within the project lands.
For the purposes of section 18 of the Act, a scheme is effective on the agreement in writing of both the federal Minister and the First Nation.

Heading.Label: PART 10
Heading.TitleText: Adaptations to the Pipeline Act of Alberta and to the Regulations Made Under It

Section.Text: In this Part, Act means the Pipeline Act of Alberta, RSA 2000, c. P-15.

Heading.Label: DIVISION 1
Heading.TitleText: Adaptations to the Pipeline Act

Section.Text: The Act applies to pipelines that are used for, or in connection with, oil sands mining activities on the project lands.
The definition road in clause 1(1)(y) of the Act is to be read as meaning land that is used or surveyed for use as a public road, street, lane or other public way, but does not include a highway.
The Regulator cannot order that His Majesty in right of Canada pay any costs under subsection 33(2) of the Act.
A report under subsection 35(5) of the Act must also immediately be given to the federal Minister and the First Nation.
For the purposes of section 38 of the Act, an approval of the Minister set out in the section is effective on the agreement in writing of the First Nation.
A reference to “the local authority concerned” in section 39 of the Act is to be read as a reference to the First Nation.
Any regulation made under the Act with respect to entry on a person’s land without that person’s agreement does not apply with respect to the project lands.

Heading.Label: DIVISION 2
Heading.TitleText: Adaptations to the Pipeline Rules of Alberta

Section.Text: The reference to “Surveys Act” in subsection 4(1) of the Pipeline Rules of Alberta, AR 91/2005 is to be read as a reference to the Canada Lands Surveys Act.

Heading.Label: PART 11
Heading.TitleText: Adaptations to the Responsible Energy Development Act of Alberta and to the Regulations Made Under It

Section.Text: In this Part, Act means the Responsible Energy Development Act of Alberta, SA 2012, c. R-17.3.

With respect to the acts and regulations listed in the definitions energy resource enactment and specified enactment in subsection 1(1) of the Act, only those that are expressly set out in Schedule 1 of these Regulations are incorporated under these Regulations.
The reference to “landowners” in section 15 of the Act is to be read to include the First Nation.
A reference to “Crown” in subsection 50(3) of the Act is to be read as including a reference to “Crown in right of Canada”.

Any reference to “person who may be directly and adversely affected” or “person who is directly and adversely affected” or “person who believes that the person may be directly and adversely affected” in the Act or in the regulations made under it is to be read as including the federal Minister and the First Nation.

Heading.Label: PART 12
Heading.TitleText: Adaptations to the Safety Codes Act of Alberta

Section.Text: A written notice under clauses 55(1)(b) and 56(1)(b) of the Safety Codes Act of Alberta, RSA 2000, c. S-1, must be given to the First Nation.
